item.title: Bins on pavement, 6th December
item.description:
New flats 15a-d have left their bins on pavement despite having designated bin stores. This is the second time I have had to report this, the bins are a hazard particularly when it is dark as this end of road has limited lighting
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Mera Drive, Barnehurst, Greater London

item.title: Illegal Parking on Yellow Lines, Brimsdown Avenue (East Side) Lazy Commuters Illegally Parking on Yellow Lines, narrowing Brimsdown Avenue access for 191 Bus Service, 6th December
item.description:
Commuters using Brimsdown Station illegally park all day on yellow lines on Eastern Side of Brimsdown Avenue. Regular road rage caused (car horns blaring, drivers shouting at each other, and even drivers getting out of their cars threatening other drivers) all due to Illegal Parking. This is a 191 Bus Route, however due to the ongoing and regular illegal parking Buses are being held as the Yellow Line Brimsdown Avenue Gap being occupied by lazy Rail Commuters. Enfield Council - It would help if you occassionally cleared the leaves away from Brimsdown Avenue, as it would be so much easier for Lazy Commuters to notice they are illegally parking on Yellow Lines.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 5, Brimsdown Avenue, Ponders End, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Abandoned car, 6th December
item.description:
Have reported to the police but nothing happened. Car was abandoned. Doors open. Same as last one. Please could it be removed.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Garden Walk, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Young tree needs attention, 6th December
item.description:
The young tree that is outside 132 Sherwood Park Ave has had the supports taken away far too soon and is now bent at a 45* angle. Needs a post to support its growth in the right direction especially as we are now getting some high winds

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 114, Sherwood Park Avenue, Blendon, Sidcup, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Unsafe cycling surface, 6th December
item.description:
Unsafe area for cyclists & pedestrians in the icy weather. No grit put down on the area in the morning (peak commute time) of Friday 5th December, I have subsequently fallen off my bike and broken my cheekbone requiring surgery. Needs to be gritted, or a safer surface to be laid down. Also witnessed multiple other falls of cyclists, scooters & pedestrians, including children on the war to school. Extremely unsafe.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Calton Avenue, Dulwich Village, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet
